message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a method for applying differential privacy to text representation and learning personalized differentially private word embedding models on user-generated content. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques and privacy-preserving methods, which are commonly studied in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the trade-off between privacy and data utility, which is a topic of interest in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves regression tasks, which are commonly studied in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a framework-independent and data-independent approach, which is relevant to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
